meanings.definition: To extend or project outward beyond the main body or line.
meanings.sent1: The balcony jettied out from the house, providing a lovely view of the garden.
meanings.sent2: She jettied her arm out to catch the falling book.
meanings.sent3: The cat jettied its paw out to play with the dangling string.
meanings.sent4: His confidence jettied out during the presentation, impressing everyone.
meanings.sent5: The tree's branches jettied out in all directions, creating a beautiful canopy.

meanings.definition: A structure built out from a building, typically supported by a row of columns or posts.
meanings.sent1: The jettied balcony added charm to the old building.
meanings.sent2: The jettied overhang provided shade for the entrance.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the jettied ledge, chirping happily.
meanings.sent4: The jettied extension of the house resembled a welcoming embrace.
meanings.sent5: The jettied structure stood out against the plain facade of the building.
